required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Otitis Media With Effusion in Chronic Sinusitis With Polyps
clinical_study.official_title: Chronic Otitis Media With Effusion in Chronic Sinusitis With Polyps

brief_summary.textblock: The relationship between otitis media with effusion (OME) and chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis (CRSwNP) remains unclear. A cross-sectional study of 80 consecutively presenting patients who were diagnosed with CRSwNP was conducted. The aim was to ascertain the prevalence of OME in CRSwNP patients, to determine whether the severity of CRSwNP affected OME, and to identify risk factors for OME in CRSwNP patients.

primary_outcome.measure: The prevalence of OME in CRSwNP patients.

intervention.description: At onset, each participant had: sinonasal evaluation (several nasal signs and symptoms were evaluated, bilateral endoscopic nasal examination, computed tomography (CT) of the sinuses when sinus surgery became necessary). otologic evaluation (evaluation of middle ear status, documentations of personal history of otologic disease, otoscopic examination, pure-tone audiometry and tympanometry)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis (CRSwNP)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 15 years of age
- Presence of chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis (CRSwNP) previously diagnosed or diagnosed at study's onset by endoscopic nasal examination
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of a mucopurulent discharge or granuloma during endoscopic nasal examination
